title: John Chapter 16 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on John chapter 16 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: John Chapter 16 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of John Chapter 16.

questions.question: According to John 16:2, what will those who kill believers think they are doing?
options: Doing God service
Punishing sinners
Protecting the law
Spreading peace
questions.correctAnswer: Doing God service
questions.explanation: John 16:2 states that those who kill believers will think they are doing God service.

questions.question: Why will believers be put out of the synagogues, according to John 16:2?
options: Because they follow Jesus
Because they are sinners
Because they are priests
Because they disobey laws
questions.correctAnswer: Because they follow Jesus
questions.explanation: John 16:2 indicates believers will be put out of synagogues as a consequence of their faith in Jesus.

questions.question: What reason does Jesus give in John 16:3 for why these wrongs will be done to believers?
options: Because they have not known the Father nor Jesus
Because they broke the law
Because they opposed the leaders
Because they are rebellious
questions.correctAnswer: Because they have not known the Father nor Jesus
questions.explanation: John 16:3 explains that these acts are done because the perpetrators have not known the Father nor Jesus.

questions.question: In John 16:7, why is it expedient for Jesus to go away?
options: So the Comforter will come
So the disciples can rest
So the temple can be rebuilt
So the law can be fulfilled
questions.correctAnswer: So the Comforter will come
questions.explanation: John 16:7 states it is expedient for Jesus to go away so that the Comforter may come to the disciples.

questions.question: According to John 16:8, what three things will the Comforter reprove the world of?
options: Sin, righteousness, and judgment
Love, peace, and joy
Faith, hope, and charity
Law, prophets, and kings
questions.correctAnswer: Sin, righteousness, and judgment
questions.explanation: John 16:8 clearly states that the Comforter will reprove the world of sin, righteousness, and judgment.

questions.question: Fill in the blank from John 16:22: 'And ye now therefore have sorrow: but I will see you again, and your heart shall ______.'
options: rejoice
weep
frown
lament
questions.correctAnswer: rejoice
questions.explanation: John 16:22 says that after sorrow, Jesus will see the disciples again and their heart shall rejoice.

questions.question: True or False: According to John 16:11, the prince of this world is judged.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: John 16:11 states that judgment occurs because the prince of this world is judged.

questions.question: What will the Spirit of truth do according to John 16:13?
options: Guide into all truth
Perform miracles
Write new scripture
Preach in the temple
questions.correctAnswer: Guide into all truth
questions.explanation: John 16:13 explains that the Spirit of truth will guide the disciples into all truth.

questions.question: Who does Jesus say has all things, as mentioned in John 16:15?
options: The Father
The disciples
The Pharisees
The Comforter
questions.correctAnswer: The Father
questions.explanation: John 16:15 states that all things the Father has are Jesus', indicating divine ownership.

questions.question: According to John 16:20, what will happen to the disciples' sorrow?
options: It shall be turned into joy
It will increase
It will remain forever
It will be forgotten
questions.correctAnswer: It shall be turned into joy
questions.explanation: John 16:20 assures that the sorrow of the disciples will be turned into joy.

questions.question: True or False: John 16:23 says that in that day, the disciples shall ask Jesus nothing but will ask the Father in Jesus' name.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: John 16:23 teaches that disciples will ask the Father in Jesus' name and not ask Jesus directly.

questions.question: What does Jesus say in John 16:28 about where He came from and where He is going?
options: He came from the Father and goes back to the Father
He came from Jerusalem and goes to Nazareth
He came from the temple and goes to the market
He came from the people and goes to the priests
questions.correctAnswer: He came from the Father and goes back to the Father
questions.explanation: John 16:28 states Jesus came forth from the Father and will leave the world to go to the Father.

questions.question: According to John 16:33, what does Jesus say to encourage believers facing tribulation?
options: Be of good cheer; I have overcome the world
Run away from danger
Pray for immediate escape
Ignore the troubles
questions.correctAnswer: Be of good cheer; I have overcome the world
questions.explanation: John 16:33 encourages believers to be of good cheer because Jesus has overcome the world despite tribulations.

questions.question: True or False: John 16:32 says Jesus will be left completely alone without the Father.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: John 16:32 states Jesus will be left alone by the disciples but not alone because the Father is with Him.

questions.question: When Jesus says 'A little while, and ye shall not see me: and again, a little while, and ye shall see me' in John 16:16, what were the disciples' reaction?
options: They did not understand what He meant
They immediately understood
They laughed in joy
They left Him confused
questions.correctAnswer: They did not understand what He meant
questions.explanation: John 16:17-18 shows the disciples questioned among themselves because they did not understand Jesus' statement.

medium.title: John Chapter 16 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from John Chapter 16 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A believer is feeling sorrow because of upcoming hardships. Based on John 16, what hope can you share to encourage them?
options: Their sorrow will turn into joy
They will be abandoned in their sorrow
They should hide their feelings
Sorrow means they are not faithful
questions.correctAnswer: Their sorrow will turn into joy
questions.explanation: John 16:20-22 teaches that although believers will weep and lament, their sorrow will be turned into joy, just like a woman forgetting her anguish after childbirth. This brings hope and comfort during trials.

questions.question: How does John 16 instruct believers to approach prayer when they face needs or challenges?
options: Ask the Father in Jesus' name and receive joy
Pray only when in church
Ask others to pray for you instead
Pray without faith and doubt the answer
questions.correctAnswer: Ask the Father in Jesus' name and receive joy
questions.explanation: John 16:23-24 encourages believers to ask the Father in Jesus' name, promising that they will receive, so their joy may be full. This teaches the importance of faith-filled prayer directly to God.

questions.question: A church member struggles with doubt about Jesus’ identity. What biblical truth from John 16 would strengthen their faith?
options: Jesus came from the Father and knows all things
Jesus is only a good teacher
Jesus sometimes does not know everything
Faith is not necessary to believe in Jesus
questions.correctAnswer: Jesus came from the Father and knows all things
questions.explanation: John 16:30 affirms that Jesus knows all things and came forth from God, which strengthens believers' faith by affirming His divine origin and wisdom.

questions.question: What does John 16 say about the role of the Comforter (Holy Spirit) in a believer’s life?
options: He will guide into all truth and glorify Jesus
He will speak on his own authority
He will leave believers to struggle alone
He will teach only worldly wisdom
questions.correctAnswer: He will guide into all truth and glorify Jesus
questions.explanation: John 16:13-14 teaches that the Spirit of truth will guide believers into all truth and glorify Jesus by showing what He receives from the Father, aiding spiritual growth and discernment.

questions.question: How can John 16 help a believer understand the trials they face from those who reject the Gospel?
options: Opposition happens because they do not know the Father nor Jesus
Trials mean God has abandoned them
Believers should avoid all conflicts
Opposition proves the Gospel is false
questions.correctAnswer: Opposition happens because they do not know the Father nor Jesus
questions.explanation: John 16:2-3 explains that believers will be put out and persecuted because those who oppose them do not know the Father or Jesus, helping believers understand opposition is rooted in spiritual blindness.

questions.question: A Christian parent wants to teach their children about perseverance in trials. What lesson from John 16 is most applicable?
options: Jesus’ followers will face tribulation but can have peace in Him
Trials mean God is punishing them
Avoid all hardships to keep faith strong
Sorrow should be hidden from others
questions.correctAnswer: Jesus’ followers will face tribulation but can have peace in Him
questions.explanation: John 16:33 tells believers that although they will have tribulation in the world, they can be of good cheer because Jesus has overcome the world, encouraging perseverance and peace through faith.

questions.question: How does John 16 teach about humility and dependence on God in daily life?
options: Believers must depend on the Spirit’s guidance, not their own understanding
Believers can rely solely on their own wisdom
God expects believers to figure everything out themselves
The Spirit will only guide those naturally wise
questions.correctAnswer: Believers must depend on the Spirit’s guidance, not their own understanding
questions.explanation: John 16:13 explains the Spirit of truth will guide believers into all truth, indicating the need for humble dependence on God's Spirit rather than trusting solely in human understanding.

questions.question: True or False: According to John 16, Jesus assures believers that their joy can never be taken away.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: John 16:22 states that the joy believers have will not be taken from them, offering assurance and security in their relationship with Christ.

questions.question: True or False: John 16 teaches that Jesus will always be physically present with believers to guide them.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: John 16:7 explains that Jesus must go away so the Comforter (Holy Spirit) can come and guide believers, indicating Jesus’ physical presence will end but spiritual guidance continues.

questions.question: How does John 16 encourage believers to handle persecution and rejection from their community?
options: Recognize it is due to others not knowing the Father or Jesus
Retaliate with anger and bitterness
Withdraw completely from community life
Doubt their faith and stop witnessing
questions.correctAnswer: Recognize it is due to others not knowing the Father or Jesus
questions.explanation: John 16:3 states persecution happens because people have not known the Father or Jesus, encouraging believers to maintain faith and understanding rather than bitterness or withdrawal.

questions.question: A believer is confused about Jesus’ statement ‘a little while, and ye shall not see me.’ How does John 16 clarify this?
options: Jesus will leave to go to the Father and will return
Jesus will disappear forever
Jesus will never be seen again
Jesus meant a very long time
questions.correctAnswer: Jesus will leave to go to the Father and will return
questions.explanation: John 16:16-17 clarifies that Jesus’ departure is temporary as He goes to the Father, and the disciples will see Him again, reassuring believers of His return.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Jesus said, 'It is expedient for you that I _____ away: for if I go not away, the Comforter will not come unto you.'
options: go
stay
hide
wait
questions.correctAnswer: go
questions.explanation: John 16:7 states it is necessary that Jesus goes away so the Comforter (Holy Spirit) can come to the believers, emphasizing divine timing in spiritual guidance.

questions.question: According to John 16, what is the basis for the Spirit’s conviction of the world regarding sin?
options: Because they believe not on Jesus
Because they keep the law perfectly
Because they attend synagogue
Because they are rich
questions.correctAnswer: Because they believe not on Jesus
questions.explanation: John 16:9 teaches that the Spirit will convict the world of sin specifically because they do not believe in Jesus, highlighting faith as the key to righteousness.

questions.question: How does John 16 instruct believers about sharing the knowledge of God and Jesus?
options: The Spirit will show believers things to come and glorify Jesus
Believers should keep knowledge secret
Jesus will teach everything directly only
Knowledge is not important for faith
questions.correctAnswer: The Spirit will show believers things to come and glorify Jesus
questions.explanation: John 16:13-14 reveals the Spirit's role in guiding believers into truth and glorifying Jesus by revealing what He receives, emphasizing the Spirit's ongoing teaching ministry.

questions.question: What assurance does Jesus give believers about facing the world’s troubles in John 16?
options: He has overcome the world and offers peace
Believers will be left to face troubles alone
Troubles mean failure of faith
God will remove all troubles immediately
questions.correctAnswer: He has overcome the world and offers peace
questions.explanation: John 16:33 assures believers that although they will experience tribulation, Jesus has overcome the world, providing peace and encouragement to remain steadfast.

hard.title: John Chapter 16 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from John Chapter 16.

questions.question: In John 16:7, why does Jesus say it is expedient for Him to go away?
options: So that the Comforter may come to the disciples
So that the disciples will understand the Law better
To fulfill the Old Testament prophecies
To demonstrate His power over death
questions.correctAnswer: So that the Comforter may come to the disciples
questions.explanation: John 16:7 states that it is necessary for Jesus to go away so that the Comforter (Holy Spirit) can come to the disciples, highlighting the role of the Spirit in continuing Jesus' work.

questions.question: According to John 16:8-11, what are the three things the Spirit of truth will reprove the world of?
options: Sin, righteousness, and judgment
Law, prophecy, and grace
Faith, hope, and love
Heaven, earth, and hell
questions.correctAnswer: Sin, righteousness, and judgment
questions.explanation: John 16:8-11 explains that the Spirit will convict the world regarding sin (unbelief in Jesus), righteousness (Jesus going to the Father), and judgment (the prince of this world being judged).

questions.question: What theme found in John 16:21 about sorrow turning to joy is typologically related to which Old Testament experience?
options: The birth of Isaac to Sarah (Genesis 21)
The Exodus from Egypt (Exodus 12)
The fall of Jericho (Joshua 6)
The giving of the Law at Sinai (Exodus 20)
questions.correctAnswer: The birth of Isaac to Sarah (Genesis 21)
questions.explanation: John 16:21 uses the metaphor of a woman’s labor pain turning to joy at childbirth, which typologically connects to Sarah’s long-awaited joy at Isaac’s birth (Genesis 21), illustrating suffering followed by divine joy.

questions.question: In John 16:13, what is the key characteristic of the Spirit of truth’s teaching?
options: He will not speak on His own authority but only what He hears
He will perform miracles to convince the world
He will write new scriptures for the disciples
He will reveal secret mysteries unknown to the Father
questions.correctAnswer: He will not speak on His own authority but only what He hears
questions.explanation: John 16:13 emphasizes that the Spirit of truth will guide the disciples into all truth by speaking only what He hears, demonstrating divine unity and authority in revelation.

questions.question: How does Jesus describe the relationship between the Father and Himself in John 16:15?
options: All things that the Father has are His, so the Spirit will take from Him and show to the disciples
He is separate and distinct from the Father in all things
He competes with the Father for authority
He has more authority than the Father
questions.correctAnswer: All things that the Father has are His, so the Spirit will take from Him and show to the disciples
questions.explanation: John 16:15 shows the intimate unity between Father and Son, where Jesus declares that everything the Father has is His, and the Spirit will take from Jesus to reveal to the disciples.

questions.question: What does the phrase 'a little while' in John 16:16-18 foreshadow in the narrative of the Gospel?
options: Jesus’ death, resurrection, and return to the Father
The destruction of Jerusalem
The coming of the Messiah
The giving of the Law to Moses
questions.correctAnswer: Jesus’ death, resurrection, and return to the Father
questions.explanation: The phrase 'a little while' in John 16:16-18 foreshadows Jesus’ impending death, the temporary absence from His disciples, and His resurrection followed by His ascension to the Father.

questions.question: According to John 16:23-24, how is prayer to the Father to be made after Jesus’ departure?
options: In Jesus’ name, and requests will be granted
Only by the high priests
Through sacrifices at the temple
In silence without words
questions.correctAnswer: In Jesus’ name, and requests will be granted
questions.explanation: John 16:23-24 teaches that after Jesus’ departure, believers will ask the Father directly in Jesus’ name, and their requests will be granted, emphasizing the new access to God through Christ.

questions.question: What is the significance of Jesus saying 'I came forth from the Father, and am come into the world; again, I leave the world, and go to the Father' in John 16:28?
options: It reveals His divine origin and mission, and foreshadows His return
It denies His divine nature
It promises an earthly kingdom
It emphasizes His human ancestry
questions.correctAnswer: It reveals His divine origin and mission, and foreshadows His return
questions.explanation: John 16:28 highlights Jesus’ pre-existence and divine mission, indicating His coming from God into the world and His eventual return, which is key to Christological understanding.

questions.question: In John 16:2-3, what reason does Jesus give for why the world will persecute His followers?
options: Because they have not known the Father nor Jesus
Because they are politically rebellious
Because they refuse to pay taxes
Because they are spreading false teachings
questions.correctAnswer: Because they have not known the Father nor Jesus
questions.explanation: John 16:2-3 explains that persecution arises from ignorance of God the Father and Jesus, indicating a spiritual blindness behind opposition to believers.

questions.question: What emotional state do the disciples experience in John 16:6 after Jesus speaks about His departure?
options: Sorrow
Joy
Anger
Fear
questions.correctAnswer: Sorrow
questions.explanation: John 16:6 states that sorrow filled the disciples' hearts because Jesus told them of His impending departure, revealing their emotional struggle with His leaving.

questions.question: True or False: According to John 16:33, Jesus promises His disciples peace in Him despite the tribulation they will face in the world.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: John 16:33 explicitly states that Jesus gives peace to His disciples even though they will experience tribulation in the world, encouraging them to be of good cheer.

questions.question: How do the disciples respond in John 16:29-30 when Jesus speaks plainly about His origin and knowledge?
options: They affirm their belief that Jesus came from God
They question His teachings
They fall asleep
They decide to leave Him
questions.correctAnswer: They affirm their belief that Jesus came from God
questions.explanation: In John 16:29-30, the disciples express confidence in Jesus’ divine origin and knowledge, showing their growing faith as He speaks plainly.

questions.question: What literary device is employed in John 16:20-22 where sorrow is compared to a woman in labor who forgets her anguish after childbirth?
options: Typology
Hyperbole
Parable
Alliteration
questions.correctAnswer: Typology
questions.explanation: John 16:20-22 uses typology by likening the disciples' sorrow and subsequent joy to a woman’s labor pains and childbirth, symbolizing transformation through suffering.

questions.question: What is the significance of Jesus telling the disciples in John 16:12 that He has many things to say but they cannot bear them now?
options: It foreshadows the future revelation by the Spirit of truth
It implies the disciples are unfaithful
It means Jesus will stop teaching them
It suggests the disciples already know everything
questions.correctAnswer: It foreshadows the future revelation by the Spirit of truth
questions.explanation: John 16:12 prepares the audience for the coming of the Spirit who will guide them into all truth, indicating progressive revelation rather than immediate understanding.

questions.question: According to John 16:31-32, what is about to happen to the disciples, and how does Jesus describe His own state?
options: The disciples will be scattered and Jesus will not be alone because the Father is with Him
The disciples will conquer Jerusalem and Jesus will lead them
The disciples will become teachers and Jesus will leave the earth
The disciples will write scriptures and Jesus will ascend immediately
questions.correctAnswer: The disciples will be scattered and Jesus will not be alone because the Father is with Him
questions.explanation: John 16:31-32 states that the disciples will be scattered and leave Jesus alone, but Jesus affirms He is not alone because the Father remains with Him, highlighting divine support amidst abandonment.

theological.title: John Chapter 16 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from John Chapter 16 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: According to John 16, why will believers be put out of the synagogues and even killed?
options: Because they have not known the Father nor Jesus
Because they reject the law of Moses
Because they preach a false gospel
Because they refuse to pay taxes
questions.correctAnswer: Because they have not known the Father nor Jesus
questions.explanation: John 16:2-3 explains that believers will face persecution because those who do not know the Father or Jesus will oppose them. This aligns with the consistent biblical theme of the world rejecting God's people (Psalm 37:12, Matthew 10:22, 2 Timothy 3:12, 1 John 3:13).

questions.question: What is the purpose of Jesus telling his disciples about these persecutions beforehand?
options: So they would not be offended
So they would avoid trouble
So they could defend themselves
So they could flee to another country
questions.correctAnswer: So they would not be offended
questions.explanation: John 16:1 states that Jesus spoke these things so that the disciples would not be offended. This preparation helps believers endure hardships with faith (Isaiah 41:10, Romans 5:3-5, 1 Peter 4:12-13, 2 Corinthians 12:9-10).

questions.question: Why is it expedient for Jesus to go away according to John 16?
options: So the Comforter (Holy Spirit) may come
So He can avoid His enemies
So He can rest
So He can appoint new leaders
questions.correctAnswer: So the Comforter (Holy Spirit) may come
questions.explanation: John 16:7 teaches that Jesus must depart so the Comforter (Holy Spirit) can come to guide believers. This is consistent with Jesus’ promise to send the Spirit (John 14:16-17), and the Spirit’s work in convicting the world (John 16:8), empowering the Church (Acts 1:8), and glorifying Christ (John 16:14).

questions.question: What three things will the Spirit of Truth reprove the world of?
options: Sin, righteousness, and judgment
Love, faith, and hope
Law, prophets, and gospel
Peace, grace, and mercy
questions.correctAnswer: Sin, righteousness, and judgment
questions.explanation: John 16:8 states the Spirit will convict the world of sin (because they do not believe in Jesus), righteousness (because Jesus goes to the Father), and judgment (because the prince of this world is judged). This aligns with Scriptural teaching on conviction (Isaiah 59:2, Romans 3:23, Hebrews 9:27, Revelation 20:11-15).

questions.question: Why is the world guilty of sin according to the Spirit’s reproving?
options: Because they believe not on Jesus
Because they break the law
Because they worship idols
Because they are proud
questions.correctAnswer: Because they believe not on Jesus
questions.explanation: John 16:9 clearly states sin is reproved because people do not believe in Jesus. Faith in Christ is foundational for salvation (John 3:18, Romans 10:9, Ephesians 2:8-9, 1 John 5:1).

questions.question: How does Jesus describe the Spirit of Truth’s manner of speaking?
options: He shall not speak of himself, but what he hears
He will speak only in tongues
He will speak only to the priests
He will speak in riddles and proverbs
questions.correctAnswer: He shall not speak of himself, but what he hears
questions.explanation: John 16:13 explains the Spirit speaks not on His own authority but conveys what He hears from the Father and Son. This highlights the Trinitarian unity and the Spirit’s role as guide (Isaiah 11:2, John 14:26, 1 Corinthians 2:10-13, Hebrews 1:1-2).

questions.question: What will the Spirit of Truth do concerning Jesus, according to John 16?
options: He shall glorify Jesus
He shall replace Jesus
He shall rebuke Jesus
He shall teach a new gospel
questions.correctAnswer: He shall glorify Jesus
questions.explanation: John 16:14 states the Spirit will glorify Jesus by taking from what is His and showing it to believers. This is consistent with Jesus’ exaltation and the Spirit’s role in magnifying Christ (Luke 24:26, Acts 2:33, Philippians 2:9-11, Hebrews 1:3).

questions.question: What does Jesus mean by 'A little while, and ye shall not see me; and again, a little while, and ye shall see me'?
options: He will soon die and then rise again
He will go on a journey and return soon
He will become invisible for a time
He will be imprisoned and released
questions.correctAnswer: He will soon die and then rise again
questions.explanation: John 16:16 and following verses show Jesus predicting His death (absence) and resurrection (return). This fits the gospel narrative of the Passion and Resurrection (Isaiah 53, Psalm 16:10, Luke 24:6-7, 1 Corinthians 15:3-4).

questions.question: How does Jesus describe the sorrow and joy his disciples will experience?
options: Their sorrow will be turned into joy
They will have sorrow without joy
They will have joy without sorrow
Their sorrow will last forever
questions.correctAnswer: Their sorrow will be turned into joy
questions.explanation: John 16:20-22 uses the metaphor of childbirth to explain that though disciples will sorrow, it will turn into lasting joy after Jesus’ resurrection. This reflects biblical themes of suffering leading to glory (Psalm 30:5, Romans 8:18, James 1:2-4, 1 Peter 1:6-8).

questions.question: According to John 16, how will believers pray after Jesus' resurrection?
options: They will ask the Father in Jesus' name
They will pray only in secret
They will pray through angels
They will pray without faith
questions.correctAnswer: They will ask the Father in Jesus' name
questions.explanation: John 16:23-24 teaches believers will ask the Father directly in Jesus' name, receiving answers to complete their joy. This is a central New Testament doctrine on prayer (John 14:13-14, Romans 8:26-27, Ephesians 2:18, Hebrews 4:16).

questions.question: What is the reason Jesus gives for the Father’s love toward believers?
options: Because they have loved Jesus and believed He came from God
Because they keep the law perfectly
Because they are wealthy and generous
Because they fast and pray often
questions.correctAnswer: Because they have loved Jesus and believed He came from God
questions.explanation: John 16:27 affirms the Father loves believers because they have loved Jesus and believed in His divine origin. This reflects the biblical principle of faith and love as foundational to relationship with God (Deuteronomy 7:7, John 3:16, Romans 5:5, 1 John 4:10-11).

questions.question: What assurance does Jesus give about His knowledge and origin?
options: He knows all things and came forth from God
He is limited in knowledge but sent by God
He is a prophet but not divine
He learned from the elders
questions.correctAnswer: He knows all things and came forth from God
questions.explanation: John 16:30 shows the disciples affirm Jesus' divine knowledge and origin. The full deity of Christ is central to biblical doctrine (Isaiah 9:6, Colossians 2:9, Hebrews 1:3, John 1:1-3).

questions.question: What does Jesus say will happen to the disciples at the coming hour?
options: They will be scattered and leave Him alone
They will be crowned kings
They will build a great temple
They will defeat all their enemies
questions.correctAnswer: They will be scattered and leave Him alone
questions.explanation: John 16:32 predicts the disciples’ scattering at Jesus’ arrest, fulfilling prophecy and illustrating human weakness (Zechariah 13:7, Mark 14:50, Matthew 26:31, Luke 22:31-34).

questions.question: What final encouragement does Jesus give to His disciples about peace and tribulation?
options: In Him they have peace despite tribulation, and He has overcome the world
They will have no peace until the world ends
Peace will come only after all enemies are defeated
Tribulation means God has abandoned them
questions.correctAnswer: In Him they have peace despite tribulation, and He has overcome the world
questions.explanation: John 16:33 concludes with Jesus assuring peace in Him amid worldly tribulation, emphasizing His victory over evil. This encouragement is echoed in Psalm 46:1-3, Romans 8:37-39, 2 Timothy 4:18, Revelation 21:4.

questions.question: Why did Jesus initially refrain from telling the disciples many things, according to this chapter?
options: Because they could not bear them yet
Because He was afraid
Because He was unsure
Because He was waiting for a sign
questions.correctAnswer: Because they could not bear them yet
questions.explanation: John 16:12 explains Jesus had more to say but the disciples were not ready. This shows progressive revelation and the Spirit’s role in guiding believers into full truth (1 Corinthians 3:1-3, Hebrews 5:11-14, Luke 24:45, John 14:26).
